conclusion: Trying to figure out how the electromagnetic flowmeter works and how to calculate the flow rate Q.
The diagram shows a pipe with diameter d, a uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the flow direction, and points M and N on the pipe wall where electromotive force E is measured.
Understanding how electromotive force E is generated using the concept of Lorentz force.
Each ion in the liquid experiences a Lorentz force F = qvB, causing a separation of charges across the pipe.
The electromotive force E is proportional to the product of velocity v, magnetic field B, and distance d.
In electromagnetic flowmeters, E = Bvd, where v is the average velocity of the fluid.
Flow rate Q is defined as the volume of fluid passing through the pipe per unit time, Q = A * v.
The cross-sectional area A of a circle is πd²/4, so Q = πd²v/4.
Relating electromotive force E to flow rate Q, solving for v gives v = E / (Bd).
Substituting v into the flow rate equation, Q = πdE / (4B).
